xxl.core.collections.sweepAreas

Interface SweepAreaImplementor<E>

  • All Superinterfaces:
    MetaDataManageable<Object,Object>, MetaDataProvider<CompositeMetaData<Object,Object>>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractSAImplementor, BagSAImplementor, HashSAImplementor, ListSAImplementor

    public interface SweepAreaImplementor<E>
extends MetaDataManageable<Object,Object>
    This interface provides the core functionality for an implementor of a SweepArea. To put it more simply, an implementor acts as the underlying datastructure of a SweepArea.
    For a better understanding how a SweepArea interacts with its implementor, take a look at the design pattern Bridge whose intention is to "decouple an abstraction from its implementation so that the two can vary independently". For further information see: "Gamma et al.: DesignPatterns. Elements of Reusable Object-Oriented Software. Addision Wesley 1998."
    See Also:
    SweepArea, AbstractSAImplementor, ListSAImplementor, HashSAImplementor, Predicate, Iterator

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        void initialize(int ID,
                Predicate<? super E>[] predicates,
                Predicate<? super E> equals)
        This method is used to initialize the implementor of a SweepArea. Commonly, it is invoked in the constructor of a SweepArea to inform the underlying implementor about the ID and the query-predicates of the corresponding SweepArea.
        Parameters:
        ID - The ID of the corresponding SweepArea.
        predicates - The query-predicates of the corresponding SweepArea.
        equals - The predicate used to determine equality of objects within the SweepArea.

      • insert

        void insert(E o)
     throws IllegalArgumentException
        Inserts the given element.
        Parameters:
        o - The object to be inserted.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws an IllegalArgumentException if something goes wrong with the insertion due to the passed argument.

      • remove

        boolean remove(E o)
        throws IllegalArgumentException
        Removes the specified element.
        Parameters:
        o - The object to be removed.
        Returns:
        True if the removal has been successful, otherwise false.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws an IllegalArgumentException if something goes wrong with the removal due to the passed argument.

      • update

        E update(E o1,
         E o2)
  throws IllegalArgumentException,
         UnsupportedOperationException
        Checks if element o1 is contained and if true updates it with o2.
        Parameters:
        o1 - The object to be replaced.
        o2 - The new object.
        Returns:
        The updated object is returned.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws an IllegalArgumentException if something goes wrong with the update operation due to the passed arguments.
        UnsupportedOperationException - Throws an UnsupportedOperationException if this method is not supported.

        void clear()
        Clears this implementor. Removes all its elements, but holds its allocated resources.

              throws UnsupportedOperationException
        Returns an iterator over the elements of this implementor.

        Throws:

      • query

        Iterator<E> query(E o,
                  int ID)
           throws IllegalArgumentException
        Queries this implementor with the help of the specified query object o and the query-predicates set during initialization, see method #initialize(int, Predicate[]). Returns all matching elements as an iterator.
        Note: The returned iterator should not be used to remove any elements from this implementor!
        Parameters:
        o - The query object. This object is typically probed against the elements contained in this implementor.
        ID - An ID determining from which input this method is triggered.
        Returns:
        All matching elements of this implementor are returned as an iterator.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws an IllegalArgumentException if something goes wrong due to the passed arguments during retrieval.

      • query

        Iterator<E> query(E[] os,
                  int[] IDs)
           throws IllegalArgumentException
        Queries this SweepArea with the help of the specified query objects os and the query-predicates set during initialization, see method #initialize(int, Predicate[]). Returns all matching elements as an iterator.
        Parameters:
        os - The query objects. These objects are typically probed against the elements contained in this implementor.
        IDs - IDs determining from which input the query objects come from.
        Returns:
        All matching elements of this implementor are returned as an iterator.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws an IllegalArgumentException if something goes wrong due to the passed arguments during retrieval.

      • query

        Iterator<E> query(E[] os,
                  int[] IDs,
                  int valid)
           throws IllegalArgumentException
        Queries this implementor with the help of the specified query objects os and the query-predicates set during initialization, see method #initialize(int, Predicate[]). Returns all matching elements as an iterator. This version of query additionally allows to use partially filled arrays and specifies how many entries of such a partially filled array are valid.
        Parameters:
        os - The query objects. These objects are typically probed against the elements contained in this implementor.
        IDs - IDs determining from which input the query objects come from.
        valid - Determines how many entries at the beginning of os and IDs are valid and therefore taken into account.
        Returns:
        All matching elements of this SweepArea are returned as an iterator.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws an IllegalArgumentException if something goes wrong due to the passed arguments during retrieval.
